column5: Art, please delete the other post, I can't seem to figure out how to do it to heck with the Skat, I'll take the Albany any day https://www.canadafishingguide.net/forum-2/member-trip-reports-1/fine-wine-and-caviar-an-albany-river-adventure/
Great read Chris!  I hope Bob didn't get paid for a week of work, lol!
Bob really pissed me off just another one of the unique characters you encounter when venturing that far north I guess
Fine Caviar too.  Something special about the Albany.  I can't wait to see it again.
I dont even know bob.  but i like beer.   i dislike bob.   looks like some of the usual antics. from you guys.   i realy nesd to do a fly in someday.
Just when I get that earworm of a song out of head, BOOM back in it goes. It is very likely that that old gal Walleye will be my PB for a very long time. AWESOME job on the report man!
Cool read Chris. Bob the dick . 2 beers each ? PLEASE
Get OI to get two cement blocks and Bobbie be gone! Nice story and pics. Chris what is that marker on the rocks. Border or . .

Kewley found that. It was a top of the best campsite around. I don't know how they set it in the rock. It was a Canadian Topographic survey from 1958. Whatever metal they used, it has withstood the elements and was in good condition.
